channel.title: Trouble port fowarding
channel.description:
Hey all, I'm having some issues with port forwarding.
My router was a linksys e1000, but it got fried so we got a "AppleBaseStationExpress", and I'm not sure what the fuck is going on with it.
The problem here is, I can't get to the router page so I can set the 25 ports for the server or whatever.
EDIT: When I type the default gateway: mine is "10.0.0.1" in the address bar, it doesn't load, I've tried changing it, and I've tried making it static, and switching to different internal IP's. Not Working. :/
Please HELP?
Appreciated. :)

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

They can’t help…I’m wondering if the Basestation is even a router…it is made for macs…

Ahh! PROGRESS!

I found helpful info!

THIRD EDIT:

Okay good news and bad news.

I have a Apple Airport Express Base Station Router

I managed to get into the Router Setup

I found where to change Port Forwarding.

It then shows me this screen:[Screenshot]

I tried setting both public and private to 25. It won’t let me save the port mapping without entering an unknown number into where it says “private ip address”. Nor can I change the last number(s)?

ANY HELP, Again, would be greatly appreciated…

FOURTH EDIT: IMAGES WILL NOT SHOW, unless you right click, and “open in new tab/window”

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Look for one like that in your cmd. If you can’t find one, Idk lol you can try www.portforward.com -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

That’s an internal IP that goes with Linksys routers by default. Unfortunately, no, that doesn’t work either.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Hmm, that just doesn’t sound right… Do you se an ip with something like 192.168.###.###?

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

Sorry, I was in the middle of editing, I should state that I’m not completely computer stupid, and I know where my defaut gateway is and such.

I got the number of ports from a tutorial or something. Idk. Number isn’t important, I can always refer back.

Coincidentally what I was editing was the post you replied too, might want to take a second glance at that, ya?

The message I get when trying to go to the default gateway is; “Oops! Google Chrome could not connect to 10.0.1.1”

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:1, topic:413432”]Hey all, I’m having some issues with port forwarding.

My router was a linksys e1000, but it got fried so we got a “AppleBaseStationExpress”, and I’m not sure what the fuck is going on with it.

The problem here is, I can’t get to the router page so I can set the 25 ports for the server or whatever.

Please HELP?

Appreciated. :)[/quote]

First off, 25 ports? Uhmm no.

Second off, go to your start menu, type CMD.
When the cmd is opened type:

It will give you your Default gateway ip.
Try that.

Read full topic
